website_summaries.verdict: The Wacom Bamboo Slate and Bamboo Folio provide a practical bridge between handwritten notes on paper and making them available in the cloud.
pros: Wacom's Bamboo Slate and Folio are easy to use and a seamless way to get your written notes into the cloud without sacrificing pen and paper
cons: You may not like the feel of the pen for writing in long stretches

customer_reviews.title: THE APP IS WORTHLESS- don't waste your money on the pad because it doesn't work without the app
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Brilliant idea. IF IT WORKED. The actual pad gets pretty good reviews, but it needs an app to run. And the app doesn't work. There are hundreds of very negative reviews of the app- the average is just over 1 of 5 stars. I had the same problem many of the other users had- it wouldn't sync with Bluetooth. That's the second step, after turning it on. Spent 2 hours with customer service with both Amazon and Wacom. Amazon was trying to be helpful. Wacom's service department is just as bad as their app. I sent it back. I'm looking at other brands, and will definitely check the app reviews before I buy anything.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: very limited use. couldn't take notes on multiple pages, would restart a new page without my knowing, so the paper looked like one page but when i uploaded and viewed on my phone it would be broken up into 2 or 3 pages. Also, kept disconnecting from my iphone.

customer_reviews.title: I loved it. I bought three. Then they all crapped out on me!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this tablet. It was exactly what I wanted, and kept my notes nice and neat. I bought a large one, and a small one for travel. Then, the small one didn't work, so I sent it back for a replacement. And that replacement didn't work, so I sent it back for a refund. Now, the large one that actually worked and I LOVED, just stopped pairing with my devices like the other two I sent back. I'm so sad. I thought I had finally found a solution. WACOM does have a one-year warranty for replacement, but after this third device failing, I just don't believe it'll work.

product_meta.title: Wacom Bamboo Folio Smartpad Digital Notebook
product_meta.description:
Size:Small| Style:Slate

WACOM BAMBOO SLATE A5
Take handwritten notes and ideas further with Bamboo Slate. Write naturally with pen on any paper, then store, shape and
share your notes and ideas in the cloud.

Specifications:Ergonomics: Right or left-handed useColor: Medium gray with orange accent colorSize: Approx. 249 x 186 x 7 mmActive Area: Approx. A5 / half letter (140 × 216 mm)Pressure Levels: 1024Model: CDS-610SPen: Ballpoint penWeight: 264 g (smartpad) / 17 g (pen)Cable Included: YesTechnology: Patented electromagnetic resonance methodSystem Requirements: Bluetooth enabled iOS or Android smartphone or tablet with Wacom Inkspace app, internet
connection, maximum notepad thickness about 80 pages (<8 mm)Warranty: 1 yearItems Delivered: Bamboo Slate, pen with one extra refill, notepad, micro USB cable, quick start guide (smartphone
and tablet not included)Additional Accessories: notepads (A5/half letter, 3 pack), replacement pen, replacement ink cartridges
feature_bullets: Start with a pen in your hand and a clean sheet of paper. Capture your thoughts and ideas. Then turn them into digital, shareable files while you write. When you're ready to turn the page, just touch a button and Bamboo Slate saves your ideas
Use the free, next generation Wacom Inkspace app to convert your handwritten notes to text, edit your digitized notes and export them into JPG, PNG, PDF, SVG, or WILL files
With an optional upgrade to the all new Ink space Plus, you can convert handwriting to rich text. (Free 3 month Ink space Plus trial included with purchase)
System requirements: Bluetooth enabled iOS or Android smartphone or tablet with Wacom Ink space app/Internet connection/Maximum notepad thickness: about 80 pages ( less than 8 millimeter)
And for a short time, we’re offering limited edition Bamboo Slate large in red and blue. The pixel pattern is inspired by Minecraft and designed with the high energy, gig economy go getter in mind
